member.name: M:DotNetExtras.Common.Extensions.ObjectExtensions.IsEquivalentOf(System.Object,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks if the source object is identical to the target (comparing all instance properties and fields).
member.param: If true, non-public properties and fields will be checked along with the public properties and fields.
member.returns: True if objects are equivalent, otherwise, false.

remarks.para: The source and target objects are considered equivalent if their data types are compatible (e.g. int and long are compatible) and they meet the following criteria:

item.para: For simple types, such as string, int, DateTime, etc., both the source and target values can be typecast to the same type and found equal.
For arrays, list, and collection types, both the source and target must contain the same number of elements, and each element of the source must be equivalent to the corresponding item of the target.

For dictionaries, both the source and target must contain the same number of elements, and each element of the source must be equivalent to the corresponding item of the target found under the same key.
For hash sets, both the source and target must contain the same number of elements, and the values in both hash sets must match.
Comparison of string values is case-sensitive.
